content: Account balances can be checked for savings, checking, and investment accounts. Balances reflect available funds after pending transactions.
Transfers require source account, destination account, amount, and optional description. Internal transfers are instant, while external ones may take 1â€“3 business days.
Transaction history typically shows date, amount, description, and balance. It may include pending, completed, and declined transactions.
Deposits can be made via ATM, mobile check deposit, direct deposit, or in-person. Funds availability may vary based on method and account type.
Cash withdrawals are available at ATMs and branches. Daily limits may apply. Some ATMs charge fees for out-of-network use.
Loan options include personal, auto, mortgage, and student loans. Terms depend on credit score, income, and loan amount requested.
Interest rates vary by account type. Savings and checking accounts earn low interest; loans and credit cards charge interest based on APR.
Account statements provide a monthly summary of transactions, interest, fees, and balances. They are available digitally or by mail.
Investment accounts include stocks, bonds, ETFs, and mutual funds. Risk varies by asset type and market conditions.
Fraud detection alerts users of unusual activity. Always verify sources before sending money or giving personal info.
Customer service is available via phone, chat, and email. Support covers account access, transactions, disputes, and technical issues.
Budget tools help track spending by category, set financial goals, and analyze trends over time for better money management.
